dict.string: What is this I don't even

human_readable_ms_short=`node -pe 'var d = new Date({query}); require("util").format("%d/%d/%d %d:%s:%s.%d", d.getMonth()+1, d.getDate(), d.getFullYear(), d.getHours(), (d.getMinutes() < 10 ? "0" : "") + d.getMinutes(), (d.getSeconds() < 10 ? "0" : "") + d.getSeconds(), d.getMilliseconds())'` human_readable_ms_iso=`node -pe 'new Date({query}).toISOString()'` human_readable_ms_utc=`node -pe 'new Date({query}).toUTCString()'` human_readable_ms_long=`node -pe 'new Date({query})'`
cat << EOB
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<items>
<item uid="human-readable-ms-short" arg="$human_readable_ms_short" valid="YES" type="file"> <title>$human_readable_ms_short</title> <subtitle>{query} milliseconds since the epoch. Action to copy to the clipboard</subtitle> <icon type="fileicon">/System/Library/PreferencePanes/DateAndTime.prefPane</icon> </item>
<item uid="human-readable-ms-iso" arg="$human_readable_ms_iso" valid="YES" type="file"> <title>$human_readable_ms_iso</title> <subtitle>{query} milliseconds since the epoch, ISO format. Action to copy to the clipboard</subtitle> <icon type="fileicon">/System/Library/PreferencePanes/DateAndTime.prefPane</icon> </item>
<item uid="human-readable-ms-utc" arg="$human_readable_ms_utc" valid="YES" type="file"> <title>$human_readable_ms_utc</title> <subtitle>{query} milliseconds since the epoch, in UTC. Action to copy to the clipboard</subtitle> <icon type="fileicon">/System/Library/PreferencePanes/DateAndTime.prefPane</icon> </item>
<item uid="human-readable-ms-long" arg="$human_readable_ms_long" valid="YES" type="file"> <title>$human_readable_ms_long</title> <subtitle>{query} milliseconds since the epoch, in your local time. Action to copy to the clipboard</subtitle> <icon type="fileicon">/System/Library/PreferencePanes/DateAndTime.prefPane</icon> </item>
</items>
EOB
You should be able to do this in your head, you know
